Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வலியில் நிலைமையான் வல்லுருவம் பெற்றம்புலியின்தோல் போர்த்துமேய்ந் தற்று.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The assumed appearance of power, by a man who has no power (to restrain his senses and perform austerity), is like a cow feeding on grass covered with a tiger's skin.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A cow is shown, draped in a tiger's skin ('புலியின் தோல் போர்த்து'). It is trying to look fierce and powerful.
Layered_Composition.Midground: However, its true, weak nature is revealed by its action: it is peacefully and foolishly grazing on grass ('மேய்ந்து'). Its actions completely betray its fearsome appearance.
Layered_Composition.Background: This is presented as a direct and ridiculous simile for the impostor ascetic. This ascetic has the powerful outward appearance of a master ('வல் உருவம்'), but inwardly they lack the real strength and self-control to live up to it ('வலியில் நிலைமையான்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A powerful but weak-willed impostor is as ridiculous as a cow that wears a tiger's skin but continues to eat grass.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The cow in the tiger skin is a classic, powerful, and slightly comical image of imposture. The fundamental contradiction between its appearance and its action is the entire point. The image should be absurd.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bright, clear, natural light that reveals the absurdity of the scene without any ambiguity. The colors of the tiger skin are vibrant, which makes the cow's placid grass-eating even more ridiculous.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A clear, direct shot that captures the full absurdity of the cow in the tiger skin, grazing peacefully.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, focusing on the comical juxtaposition.

Cultural_Anchors: The weak-willed one assuming a powerful form (வலியில் நிலைமையான் வல் உருவம் பெற்றம்)
Is like a cow grazing while covered in a tiger's skin (புலியின் தோல் போர்த்து மேய்ந்தற்று)
